abstract: Comprehensive best practices guide for event-driven system programming in Rust, covering async runtimes, channels, threading, sockets, terminals, signals, and streaming I/O. Contains 42 rules across 8 categories, prioritized by impact from critical (async patterns, channel communication) to incremental (event loop architecture). Each rule includes detailed explanations, real-world examples comparing incorrect vs. correct implementations, and specific impact metrics to guide automated refactoring and code generation.
